intro: Asterolasia woombye var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-flowered asterolasia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry open forests, preferring well-drained soils. It has aromatic leaves and is often found in the eastern regions of Queensland. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
